018package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.procedure;
019
020import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TableName;
021import org.apache.yetus.audience.InterfaceAudience;
022
023/**
024 * Procedures that operates on a specific Table (e.g. create, delete, snapshot, ...) must implement
025 * this interface to allow the system handle the lock/concurrency problems.
026 */
027@InterfaceAudience.Private
028public interface TableProcedureInterface {
029  public enum TableOperationType {
030    CREATE,
031    DELETE,
032    DISABLE,
033    EDIT,
034    ENABLE,
035    READ,
036    FLUSH,
037    SNAPSHOT,
038    REGION_SNAPSHOT,
039    REGION_EDIT,
040    REGION_SPLIT,
041    REGION_MERGE,
042    REGION_ASSIGN,
043    REGION_UNASSIGN,
044    REGION_GC,
045    MERGED_REGIONS_GC/* region operations */,
046    REGION_TRUNCATE
047  }
048
049  /** Returns the name of the table the procedure is operating on */
050  TableName getTableName();
051
052  /**
053   * Given an operation type we can take decisions about what to do with pending operations. e.g. if
054   * we get a delete and we have some table operation pending (e.g. add column) we can abort those
055   * operations.
056   * @return the operation type that the procedure is executing.
057   */
058  TableOperationType getTableOperationType();
059}
